topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Removing Object Storage Daemon (OSD) Node

body.p:
Perform the following steps to remove the OSD node:
Login to the deployer/lifecycle-manager node.
Make a note of the OSD numbers on the OSD node to be removed. A sample of OSD node is as follows:$ ceph osd tree # id weight type name up/down reweight -1 6 root default -2 3 host padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0003-mgmt 0 1 osd.0 up 1 3 1 osd.3 up 1 6 1 osd.6 up 1 -4 3 host padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt 1 1 osd.1 up 1 4 1 osd.4 up 1 7 1 osd.7 up 1 -3 3 host padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0002-mgmt 2 1 osd.2 up 1 5 1 osd.5 up 1 8 1 osd.8 up 1
For example, to remove the OSD node padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt, the OSD numbers 1, 4 and 7 are relevant.
Stop the OSDs running on the specific host by executing the following command :cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-stop.yml --limit <osd-node-to-remove>Replace the string (osd-node-to-remove) in above command with the OSD host to be removed from cluster (for example: stratushelion-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt ).
Execute the following command for each OSD number (obtained from step #2 above):ceph osd out <osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph auth del osd.<osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph osd crush remove osd.<osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph osd rm <osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster>Replace the string <ceph_cluster> with the name of your Ceph cluster (default cluster name is ceph).
Run the following command to remove the OSD host from the Ceph CRUSH map :ceph osd crush remove <host-name> Replace the string <host-name> in the above command.
Remove the section for the OSD host from ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file.
Commit your configurationcd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Remove OSD node <host-name>"
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.ymlReplace the string <host-name> in the above commit message with the actual host name (i.e. padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt as mentioned in the above example).
Log in to the OSD node and un-mount the data and journal disks. Also remove the mount instructions for the same disks from the /etc/fstab file.
